title: Local obituary: Henry Oberlander, 29, standout wrestler at Xaverian Brothers and Bridgewater State
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Henry Oberlander, 29, of Norwood, MA, passed away on November 5, 2025, in an automobile accident.
Oberlander was a standout wrestler at Xaverian Brothers High School and Bridgewater State University.
He was preparing to join his father's engineering business after working five years in Boston Local 560.

title: Boston.com readers share how the reduction in flights has impacted their travels
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Logan Airport experienced significant disruptions with over 440 delays and 107 cancellations on Sunday due to FAA traffic reductions.
Airlines are waiving fees and offering refunds as the FAA slashes air traffic at 40 airports during the government shutdown.
Boston.com readers express frustrations and concerns about travel plans, with many avoiding Logan or altering flight plans.

title: Former Patriot Damien Woody made a bold prediction after New England’s win vs. Buccaneers
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Patriots improved to 8-2 after a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers, tying for the best AFC record.
Former Patriot Damien Woody predicts the road to the Super Bowl goes through Foxborough on ESPN's 'Get Up!' segment.
Patriots have a seven-game winning streak; tied in AFC standings with Broncos and Colts after win on Sunday.

title: Western Mass. police chief arrested in school parking lot, allegedly tried to solicit sex from undercover cop
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Cheshire Police Chief Michael Alibozek, 53, arrested for soliciting sex from an undercover cop in a school parking lot.
Alibozek has been on paid administrative leave, firearm and police station access seized, pending further actions.
The town has informed Massachusetts POST and plans for an acting chief following an emergency meeting remain undecided.

title: Motorcyclist seriously injured in Tewksbury crash
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 56-year-old Dracut man was critically injured in a motorcycle crash in Tewksbury Friday night near Brook Street.
Tewksbury police found the unconscious motorcyclist in woods off the road; he had suffered a serious head injury.
The injured man was airlifted to Lahey Hospital; his condition remains critical as of Saturday afternoon.

title: Mike Vrabel had a blunt response to report about Titans owner’s alleged grudge
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel dismissed a report suggesting Titans owner Amy Adams Strunk holds a grudge against him after his 2024 firing.
Vrabel appreciated traveling New England Patriots fans and their support during the team's recent win over the Buccaneers.
Vrabel emphasized the need for the Patriots to play their best football in November as they prepare for a Thursday game.

title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Celtics' bench excelled in their 111-107 win over the Orlando Magic, with significant contributions from Luka Garza.
Luka Garza scored 16 points in 17 minutes, with 12 points in the fourth quarter and crucial offensive rebounds.
Jordan Walsh's defensive performance was key, including a decisive 3-pointer, enhancing his case for more playing time.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek signed a new contract to continue as the Red Sox game-planning and run prevention coach for 2026.
Varitek has spent nearly 30 years with the Boston Red Sox, serving various roles since retiring as a player.
Catchers and pitchers benefit from Varitek's expertise; Carlos Narvaez highlighted for his promising first full MLB season.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson scored three touchdowns in the Patriots' 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Williams and Henderson made plays over 50 yards, contributing 222 of New England's 435 total offensive yards.
Rookie linemen Will Campbell and Jared Wilson helped limit sacks, while defensive rookies Craig Woodson and Elijah Ponder made key plays.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye led the New England Patriots to a 28-23 win over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers with 270 passing yards.
Oddsmakers now list Patriots' Drake Maye as the NFL MVP favorite, overtaking contenders like Josh Allen and Patrick Mahomes.
This season, Maye has completed 71.7% of passes for 2,555 yards, 19 touchdowns, and rushed for 283 yards and two touchdowns.
